newsitem.title: GERMANY: German sugarbeet sowings begin in warmer regions.
newsitem.headline: German sugarbeet sowings begin in warmer regions.

text.p: German farmers have started sugarbeet sowings in some areas which usually receive warmer temperatures than the rest of the country, a source at the national meteorological office DWD said on Monday.
"We've had reports of sugarbeet plantings from the Lower Rhine and Franconia, where farmers are finished with spring grains," he said.

Farmers initially planned to sow the bulk of the crop later in March but a cold front expected over the next 10 days might delay the process, with the Easter holidays on March 28-31 creating another hiatus, he added.
The cold front would also slow the early development of the beet currently sown after planting conditions in the first half of March were ideal.
The 1997/98 area may slightly exceed the 516,452 hectares seen in 1996/97, sources have said.
